Sentencas: Carbon dioxide electrolysis was studied in Ni/YSZ electrode supported Solid Oxide Electrolysis Cells (SOECs) consisting of a Ni-YSZ Support, a Ni-YSZ electrode layer, a YSZ electrolyte, and a LSM-YSZ O-2 electrode (YSZ=Yttria Stabilized Zirconia).
Titulo: Electrolysis of carbon dioxide in Solid Oxide Electrolysis Cells

Sentencas: The results of this study show that long term CO2 electrolysis is possible in SOECs with nickel electrodes.
Titulo: Electrolysis of carbon dioxide in Solid Oxide Electrolysis Cells

Sentencas: The passivation rate of the SOEC was between 0.22 and 0.44 mVh(-1) when operated in mixtures of CO2/CO = 70/30 or CO2/CO=98/02 (industrial grade) at 850 degrees C and current densities between -0.25 and -0.50 A cm(-1).
Titulo: Electrolysis of carbon dioxide in Solid Oxide Electrolysis Cells

Sentencas: The passivation rate was independent of the current density and irreversible when operated at conditions that would oxidise carbon.
Titulo: Electrolysis of carbon dioxide in Solid Oxide Electrolysis Cells

Sentencas: This clearly shows that the passivation was not caused by coke formation.
Titulo: Electrolysis of carbon dioxide in Solid Oxide Electrolysis Cells

Sentencas: On the other hand, the passivation was partly reversible when introducing hydrogen.
Titulo: Electrolysis of carbon dioxide in Solid Oxide Electrolysis Cells

Sentencas: The passivation may be a consequence of impurities in the gas stream, most likely sulphur, adsorbing on some specific nickel sites in the cathode of the SOEC.
Titulo: Electrolysis of carbon dioxide in Solid Oxide Electrolysis Cells

Sentencas: Activation can be carried out by hydrogen reacting with adsorbed sulphur to form the volatile compound H2S. Because adsorption of sulphur is site specific, only a part of the nickel sites were passivated and long-time operation of CO2 electrolysis in these Ni/YSZ electrode supported Solid Oxide Electrolysis Cells seems therefore feasible.
Titulo: Electrolysis of carbon dioxide in Solid Oxide Electrolysis Cells
